TopicTitle: Space 1999 Eagle er.. Kerbal 2012 Command Pod w/extras

Articles.Content:
Presenting my first foray into KSP modding..

Space 1999 Eagle Command Module.

More views:

See if you can crash more Eagles, than Moonbase Alpha did back in the series...

I\'ll be working on new parts in the future to connect to the command module, so you can build a full fledged working Eagle. So stay tuned.

Also, I built a Space Shuttle sized SRB to help get your Eagle into orbit and beyond, the RS-1.

See here:

Download here:

Eagle ver. 1.0: http://www.redspar.com/ksp/RedSpar_Eagle_Pod.rar

Solid Booster ver 1.0: http://www.redspar.com/ksp/solidBooster_RedSpar.rar

Unrar and move the folders to your KSP Parts directory.
The command mod is awesome! I\'ll try it later .

i like

will download when i get home. well done, this is fantastic. very nice rocket models.

also, welcome to the forums!!!
thumbs up for an awesome logo and command pod.
woohoo thats a super commandpod man great work

Man, I was just thinking of how well an Eagle would work as a model in KSP, with its modular structure. I hope you get the chassis/engines and pod parts modelled too.

I have to confess I\'m kind of surprised anyone here is old enough to remember Space: 1999. I had the Dinky model of an Eagle when I was little, I used to love it.

Thanks all!

Man, I was just thinking of how well an Eagle would work as a model in KSP, with its modular structure. I hope you get the chassis/engines and pod parts modelled too.

I have to confess I\'m kind of surprised anyone here is old enough to remember Space: 1999. I had the Dinky model of an Eagle when I was little, I used to love it.

Well, Victor, I\'m no spring chicken. I\'m going to be 45yrs old next week. :\'( I used to watch Space 1999 religiously every weekend (mainly for the Eagles!) I remember building an Eagle model kit and then promptly blowing it up with firecrackers!

I\'m going to start work on the chassis and engines today, so hopefully we\'ll have a full fledged Eagle to crash soon!

It\'s a great pod and I can \'go\' with it wanting to re-enter nose first. I do wish it had a connection point on the \'top\' (not nose) so it would splash down horizontal (bottom side down) If the basic model was given a longer and sharper pointed nose, it would also look more like the old \'Planet of the Apes\' space ship.
I debated whether it should have a connection point at the top. The real Eagle didn\'t really have one.. You guys want me to add one on?
Might as well, otherwise people will likely ask why you didn\'t

Eagle cargo section modeling is done. All those trusses were insane ???

Considering there were so many didn\'t come in too bad at 6320 tris (2288 polys).

Unrap and texturing next. I\'ll make the gear pods and engines separately after.

This is coming along nicely, can\'t wait to shuttle Victor Bergman to investigate some strange rock formations on the Mun....

Cheers from another 'old-timer'

Oh wow.

I am so using this as a long-range rover once my munbase grows big.

Alright, this has my attention now.

Munar cargo deliveries will be sweet.

Oh wow, this is nice.

Hmm, the thrusters on the side of the Eagle look awfully similar to the ones in the NovaPunch pack...
Did the landing gear and unwrapped and textured all night. She\'s starting to look like a real Eagle. Engines are next.
Will there be attach points inside the cargo bay?

Oh wow ... Smells like nostalgia ...

Lovely models so far, I\'m looking forward to seeing the finished product!

I must admit I\'ve been wondering about Eagle models for a long time, but my modelling skills are non-existent and I had to just wait for somebody else to want to produce one. Great to see it\'s happening!

Guys please don't necro in the future.

If you want a .21 compatible Eagle, please check Devo's thread here

-Shadow
